action.action-desc: Mr. Harder of California (for himself and Mr. Lawler) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize grants for first responder training.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Safer Response Act of 2025.
Section 546 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 290ee–1) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking tribes and tribal and inserting Tribes and Tribal;

subparagraph.text: by striking approved or cleared each place it appears and inserting approved, cleared, or otherwise legally marketed; and
by striking opioid each place it appears;
by striking approved or cleared each place it appears and inserting approved, cleared, or otherwise legally marketed;

clause.text: by striking opioid and heroin and inserting opioid, heroin, and other drug; and
by striking opioid overdose and inserting overdose; and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (3), by striking opioid and heroin; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (h), by striking $36,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023 and inserting $57,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2026 through 2030.
